name: stabones
text: bizarre!

name: zem
text: more blubbering

name: hexjumper
text: It's when it zooms in on his face that you know that Ray is really humiliated.

name: flynn
text: From this strip on I typed my whining out in this manner. A BLOOOO A BLA BLOO BLOO BLOO OOO click to post to Livejournal.

name: wittyname
text:
Oh no! Lamed by mistake!
My many apologies.

name: saint
text: you don't need to know how to blubber...it is instinctive.

name: soticoto
text: Doubly so for seals.

name: deimosrising
text: "A BLOOOO BLA BLOO BLOO BLOOOOOOOO" is the sound I make when I wish to mock a person for being a huge pussy. I sound it out very carefully whilst extending my lower lip.

name: spinynorman
text: Cackling in the background? Classic Lyle

name: achilleselbow
text: Sometimes I wish Lyle were the main character instead of Ray. Then I realize that reading the comic would just be like talking to that guy who just brags about how wasted he gets all the time.

name: spinynorman
text:
Lyle seems like the kind of guy who doesn't consider himself wasted until he no longer is capable of knowing how wasted he is.

Or, to coin a phrase, if you can tell someone how many drinks you had in one night, you weren't doing it right.

name: zapatos
text: At least he doesn't brag about how he bangs chicks all the time.  Man, I am so annoying.

name: spinynorman
text: I came through here on a archives trawl and was gonna post something about this being classic Lyle when I realized I'd already done it a year ago. Things don't change, I guess.

name: soticoto
text: Just as well you didn't say as such, or at least didn't use the word "classic". It is become synonymous with "clichéd".

name: tekende
text: If I am ever a parent, this is what I will do to my children when they whine.

name: nikitarama
text: Mommy! Daddy! I want the chocolate sunday surp - A BLOOO BLOO BLA BLOOOO!!!!!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: [SIZE="4"]Why wait.[/SIZE] Practice on other people's kids.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Size matters, dude. I'm sorry.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Apparently not to assetbar.

name: earthbound01
text: This is awesome.

name: babachewy
text: I can see this video in my mind and it is wonderful.

name: rowboat
text: Do nightmares give you hardon's?

name: catachresis
text: Ray is lying down.

name: geysershitdick
text: One of the rare occasions when the animal world interacted with the human world.

name: overmedicated
text: Classic

name: antsama
text: The ASPCA is all over this.

name: slalvation
text: "Outraged"

name: killerlimpet
text: I wish Drudge Report were this awesome

name: feetnotes
text: This is the strip that made me laugh the loudest. Imagining Ray dancing while blubbering for hours sent me over the edge. To this day I laugh out loud every time I see it.

name: mr_pete
text: Wonderful when you consider this predates Youtube by what, a year?

name: paperboy_2000
text: Yep.  I think the passage of time actually added to the joke.  Now it's instinctive to mentally fill in "YouTube" after the ellipsis.  But then the last panel is so much worse than a random YouTube video.

name: trevor
text: The first time I read this one I laughed so hard that it was difficult to breathe, and eventually I even had difficulty making sounds. The thought that this sort of laughing was kind of like blubbering made me laugh for longer.

name: aliiis
text: Oh, yes indeed. (I also like your otter)

name: greenkoolayd
text: wrong critter, ma'am.

name: epicurus
text: It is ALL about the last panel.

name: tombsgrave
text: "A BLOO BLA BLOO!" has been a regular feature in my onomonopoeia thesaurus since I read this strip.

name: heccibiggs
text:
What's so hilarious about your comment is how clear it is that you totally just made up the way to spell "onomatopoeia".

I imagine this will come across bitchier than intended.

name: rowboat
text: But he got "poeia" right. That's the part that always throws me.

name: saddestking
text: i worked at camp onomonopoeia for two summers

name: yearsinhotclaws
text: Camp Anawanna, we hold you in our hearts...

name: awko
text: A comment left by awko was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Rhadamanthus, TheLastWhiteMan)

name: qingofchina
text: With a stance like that, you could doubt that the cat ever cut a rug.

name: red_dawn
text: What in the hell happened to those shoes?

name: centipede_damascus
text: This strip had me laughing till I was abloo bloo blooing.

name: paco
text: frickin hilarious

name: littlefatdog
text: Ho my goodness. AhMazing.

name: cdl146
text: But did the shoes ever reunite with their estranged father? How can Onstad leave us hanging like this? The suspense is killing me, oh I hope it lasts...

name: jesler729
text:
Ahaha

Lyle was cackling.

name: steerpike66
text: Jump cuts like the last two frames here always cripple. Me: there is nothing in the world funnier than an effective jump-cut to stock film of an ambulance going 'Woo woo!'

name: lawdog
text: One of my coworkers just asked me if I was choking.  Apparently my silent work laugh needs work.

name: lunchbox
text: Man, you forgot the "Video..." hyperlink on those particular types of Drudge Report articles.

name: pebohead
text: of course, it just had to be Lyle filming

name: stuart
text: This punchline is the perfect way of finishing a sentence with "...Internet!"

name: oishii
text: "Crying Cat Cuts Carpet as Cameraman Cackles" is one fabulous piece of alliteration.

name: treasureplane
text: oh man is onstad cribbing from the hans christian andersen playbook?  that is hell of impressive.

name: hellofditties
text: These red shoes... they can't stop dancin'!

name: jthm_guitarist
text: What kind of strip would have to happen for everyone to vote it a perfect five??

name: farqussus
text: Ray's crying has become All Your Base. When QC starts using it, it's at least six months out of date. By 2010, Saturday Night Live will feature a depressed cow saying 'hell of'.

name: farqussus
text: Yes, I am ashamed to admit reading QC.

name: tonyhighwind
text: There is nothing wrong with reading QC.

name: tonyhighwind
text: That is also not blubbering, but mockery in the form of shapeless words.  The same effect would be achieved with "a-derp-de-derp-de-doo" such as South Park's style.

name: plummet
text:
By now I use this unique piece of onomatopoeia to mock those who are whining and crying over inconsequential matters.

"dude i'm cold, can't you turn the heat up, i hate sitting in the back all the time, why come you guys always call shotgun before me, i can't believe this..."

*Cue PLUMMET turning around in the driver's seat to face the whiny passenger.*

PLUMMET: ABLOO-BLA-BLOO-BLOO-BLOOOOOOOOO! *loudly repeated until guest quiets down*

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Oh MAN do I want to do that to someone now.

Please accept this chubby from me, Sir Plummet.

name: triptaphane
text:
When someone's tickling me mercilessly (not fun happy-time tickles, soulless, cruel and inhumane tickle torture sessions of unruly pain), I am known to make the same noise.

Reading this comic, I smooshed my arms to my sides from reflex.

name: skaterpix
text: One of the best I have ever read!

name: jhunter
text:
man the slightly smaller text in Rays panel 6 blubbering is what made this a 5 for me

I could totally see the grainy video, sound quality all shoddy, Lyle shaking the camera slightly due to laughter, and also scotch

name: arelladawn
text: Wow I can't help but audibly chortle at this turn of events.

name: mercuri0us
text: Just like in the Volvo of Despair.

name: carlyle
text: Ray is ashamed.
